title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, celebrating 20 years since his debut album.
The concert included most tracks from 'Get Lifted' and various covers, showcasing Legend's diverse musical influences.
Legend shared personal stories, including his time in Boston, and performed with backup singers SheNice Johnson, Natalie Imani, and Keri Lee.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating following Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, hinting officials influenced the game's outcome.
Brown was vocally critical after Monday's loss to the Jazz, arguing a crucial missed foul call affected the game's result.
Despite critical remarks on officiating, Brown was not fined for his comments after the Celtics' loss to the Jazz.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots face the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, both division leaders, in Tampa Bay on Sunday.
Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield has emerged as an MVP candidate, excelling with deep passes leading the NFL.
Tampa Bay's offense faces injury challenges, with key players like Chris Godwin and Mike Evans sidelined.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS for the first time since Week 6, 2023.
Nantz and Romo's assignment indicates the Patriots' renewed relevance with quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel in leading roles.
The game assignment change from Bills-Dolphins to Patriots-Buccaneers is due to Miami's poor 2-7 season record.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost 123-110 to the Orlando Magic, with Jaylen Brown scoring 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting.
The Magic capitalized on three-pointers, going 17-for-36 from deep, while the Celtics' defense struggled throughout the game.
Payton Pritchard improved his 3-point shooting, going 5-for-8, scoring 27 points despite starting the game at 22.4% for the season.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph is recommended for a public reprimand for creating an appearance of impropriety in a 2018 ICE evasion case.
The Massachusetts Commission on Judicial Conduct found insufficient evidence that Joseph authorized the escape plan for the defendant.
Judge Joseph and a court officer were previously federally charged with obstruction, but charges were dropped in 2022.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future despite playoff elimination by the Yankees.
Shortstop Trevor Story opts into his contract, while third baseman Alex Bregman chooses to opt out.
Rookie Roman Anthony expected to play a significant role in the Red Sox's future after recovering from an injury.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A wind turbine blade detached and landed in a cranberry bog near Head of the Bay Road in Plymouth.
The 75 to 100-foot blade fell with no reported injuries, and the turbine stopped automatically for safety.
Authorities, including MassDEP, are investigating the incident and have secured and cleared the affected area.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps', streaming on Disney+, revives Marvel's superhero family with Pedro Pascal and others.
'Frankenstein' by Guillermo del Toro, showcasing a unique vision of Shelley's novel, is available on Netflix.
'Materialists', a romcom satire with Dakota Johnson and Pedro Pascal, is streaming on HBO Max.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs leads the Patriots with 508 receiving yards, 56.4 yards per game, and 25 first down receptions this season.
Diggs is focused on improving his attitude, aiming to manage his perfectionist tendencies and competitive edge.
Diggs praises offensive coaches Josh McDaniels and Todd Downing for their clear guidance and creating a supportive environment.
